summary:
Applied mathematician with strong social skills. I get energized by the use of theoretical knowledge in business environments and I am sensitive to positive team spirit. In the role of Mathware Engineer, I use mathematics to model physical systems within projects in the field of Computational Physics.

üìå ABOUT ME
Having a background in Applied Mathematics, I am precise and structured both in my professional and private life. I can focus on details but, at the same time, keep track of the bigger picture. In my free time, I enjoy training my practical side with DIY projects and miniature modelling. Currently busy with a fully working roller coaster model (3D-printed vehicle, wood and plastics landscaping). 

üìå EXPERTISE & TRACK RECORD
- currently working as Mathware Engineer at Sioux Technologies 
- 3 years of experience as R&D Scientist in DSM Materials Science Center
	- supporting DSM material businesses and their customers in developing polymeric materials and applications
	- performing mathematical and physical modelling and designing and executing experimental plans
	- some focus areas: materials for solar modules, mooring ropes, life protection

üìå CONTACTS
‚úâ alessandro.gualdi.ag@gmail.com

projects: [{'title': 'Numerical simulations and comparisons between k-Œµ RNG and standard k-œâ models for Ô¨Çow around a square bluÔ¨Ä body', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'The article presents the results of numerical simulations of Ô¨Çow around square cylinder at Reynolds number of 21400. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alessandro', 'last_name': 'Gualdi', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Mathware Engineer at Sioux Technologies'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Chiara Napione', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Alessandro Cucchi', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Numerical methods for partial differential equations.', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'In this project, numerical methods for the resolution of partial differential equations are presented. We discuss their theoretical aspects and implement them with Matlab. The code is then tested on a number of different problems and analyses on convergence and accuracy are performed. In the last part, the commercial software FreeFem++ is used to solve a real life problem in a more complicated domain.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alessandro', 'last_name': 'Gualdi', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Mathware Engineer at Sioux Technologies'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Monica Ferrara', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Evaluation of interfacial stresses in reinforced deflected beams', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Using Timoshenko‚Äôs model for beams, stresses between the beam‚Äôs intrados and the FRP reinforce are computed. The solution can be obtained (working in linear elasticity) solving the system composed by the balance, kinematic and constitutive equations, which lead to two ODEs of the 6th and 7th order. A parametric study is then carried out using Mathematica and results are compared with others derived under different hypothesis. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alessandro', 'last_name': 'Gualdi', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Mathware Engineer at Sioux Technologies'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Chiara Napione', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Buckling of injection-molded plates', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'The buckling phenomenon is a mechanical instability characterized by a sudden lateral deflection of a structural part (e.g., rod or plate) of a thermoelastic body. As an applied load is increased, also the stresses inside the body increase. Eventually, they will become large enough to cause the current configuration to become unstable, and it will buckle. The present work studies the buckling of injection molded plates. In this context, the loading is represented by a decrease of the temperature of the plate, from the higher temperature after solidification of the melt to the lower one at ejection. The effect of the presence of short glass fibers in the melt is also investigated, with a particular focus on the influence of the fiber orientation in determining the buckling mode. The buckling threshold, i.e., the minimum decrease in temperature required for the disk to buckle, is computed via the Rayleigh-Ritz method. The amplitude of the warpage is determined using a perturbation scheme, in combination with a Legendre-Galerkin approach.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alessandro', 'last_name': 'Gualdi', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Mathware Engineer at Sioux Technologies'}]}]
